plot: The DVD includes such legendary dances as: &"the solo Masterpiece of the decade&", THE DESPERATE HEART (1943) by Valerie Bettis, and the darkly dramatic LYNCHTOWN (1936) by one of the founders of Modern Dance, Charles Weidman. There are important choreographers who highlight the American black experience, such as the dancer anthropologist, Pearl Primus, who created a dramatization of a poem about the black experience in THE NEGRO SPEAKS OF RIVERS (1944).   Written by  Carol Teten
title: The New Dance Group Gala Historical Concert: Retrospectives 1930s - 1970s
